name: Fundamentals in Computer Science
description: Introduction to the fundamentals of computer science. Topics include surveys of artificial intelligence, hardware/operating systems, programming languages/software, ethics/social issues, history, electronic communications, problem solving, and programming. Includes laboratory projects in computer programming.

name: Programming & Data Science
description: Introduction to the fundamentals of business computing. Topics include surveys of hardware/operating systems, programming languages/software, ethics/social issues, problem solving, and advanced MS Excel and Scratch programming for business use. Includes laboratory projects in MS Excel and Scratch.

name: Introduction to Computer Programming
description: The art and science of computing using an object-oriented programming language such as Python. Topics include looping, branching, arrays, and program development.

name: Computational Thinking for Problem Solving
description: Introduction to problem solving and programming using Python. Topics include decomposition, pattern recognition, data representation and abstraction, algorithms, fundamental operations of a modern computer, basic algorithms, and programming using Python.

name: Computer Science I
description: Introduction to programming using Python. Topics include basic program design, program flow (decisions, functions, loops), command line and file input/output, variables, types, and string/sequence processing.

name: Computer Science II
description: Design and implementation of classes and objects, arrays, sorting, searching, recursion, aggregate objects, and an introduction to graphical User Interfaces (GUIs).

name: Transfer Credits
description: Transfer credits.

name: Foundations of Computer Science
description: Topics include regular and context-free grammars, computational logic, finite state machines, and parsing.

name: Computer Systems
description: Introduction to computer systems, including CPUs, memory, storage, networking, operating systems, and parallel/distributed programming. Includes introduction to assembly language and C.

name: Computer Science III
description: Advanced topics in object-oriented programming, project design, planning, testing, text processing, inheritance, polymorphism, abstract classes, interfaces, generic classes, exception handling, and introduction to data structures.

name: Data Structures & Algorithms
description: Data structures and algorithms studied using object-oriented programming. Topics include recursion, lists, stacks, queues, linked lists, trees, hashing, searching, and sorting algorithms.

name: Computer Organization
description: Introductory topics in computer architecture, hardware design, and assembly language. Includes software for assembling, running, and debugging assembly programs.

name: Cooperative Programming
description: Work experience with an organization in the computer field, involving programming, networking, or customer support.

name: Computer Security & Ethics
description: Introduction to computer security and ethical underpinnings of security. Discusses objectives of secure systems, attack methods, and defenses.

name: Computer Security
description: Introduction to critical topics in computer security such as cryptography, network security, and operating systems security.

name: Introduction to Digital Image Processing
description: Focus on fundamental concepts in digital image processing, computer graphics, and image analysis. Uses Python, Matplotlib, and OpenCV.

name: Database Management Systems
description: Study of generalized database management systems and the design/implementation of a database system.

name: Operating Systems
description: Survey of operating systems and in-depth study of concurrency, scheduling, memory management, and file system protection.

name: Data Communications and Networking I
description: Overview of data and telecommunications, communication protocols, transmission technologies, and network types.

name: Data Communications and Networking II
description: In-depth study of modern data communication systems, including serial port communications, network performance, and Internet protocols.

name: Programming Language Concepts/Paradigms
description: Examination of programming languages and their paradigms. Topics include abstraction, bindings, concurrency, design, and types.

name: Internship
description: Work in the student's area of computer science specialty.

name: Software Engineering
description: Focus on project design, planning, testing, and programming topics such as text processing, inheritance, polymorphism, and data structures.

name: Software Testing
description: A practitioner's approach to software testing, including topics like unit testing, integration testing, functional testing, and testing methodologies.

name: Design/Construction Compilers
description: Introduction to compiler design including lexical analysis, syntax analysis, error handling, and optimization.

name: User Interfaces
description: Focus on database-driven graphical user interfaces using the Model-View-Controller software paradigm and Java/PHP components.

name: Modern Web Applications Using Server-Side Technologies
description: Training in building web applications using Node.js, Express, MongoDB, and EJS for front-end user interfaces.

name: Distributed and Parallel Computing
description: Introduction to modern distributed platforms, parallel application development, performance, and management.

name: Big Data Engineering
description: Investigation of data-intensive and big data computing challenges using distributed tools and parallel algorithms.

name: Introduction to Cloud Computing
description: Overview of technologies enabling cloud computing, including virtualization, containerization, and orchestration.

name: Modern Malware Analysis
description: Introduction to malware analysis techniques with hands-on analysis of real-world malware samples.

name: Software Security
description: Exploration of software vulnerabilities and attacks, and defenses against them, including advanced testing and program analysis.

name: Game Development
description: Project-based course focusing on game development using a modern game engine such as Unity with C# programming.

name: Artificial Intelligence
description: Simulation of intelligence in machines, covering topics such as agent architectures, constraint satisfaction, expert systems, machine learning, and robotics.

name: Independent Project in Computer Science
description: Design and implement a software system supervised by a faculty member, drawing from local industry and university departments.

name: Topics in Computer Science
description: Topic announced at time of offering.

name: Topics in Complex Large-Scale Systems
description: Topics in large scale systems announced at time of offering.

name: Topics in Computer Security
description: Topic in computer security announced at time of offering.

name: Independent Study in Computer Science
description: Student selects study topics via literature search in conjunction with an instructor.
